data.message:
Please rephrase the question and do a bit of research.

Net Neutrality is a term used to describe the principal of Internet Service Providers (ISP) and Governments to treat all internet traffic packets equally, with no special treatment or priority based on the content of them or based on the origin, so if your ISP degrades your quality of service because you are watching a video or making a skype call that is against Net Neutrality, also it prevents ISP's from selling you services based on what you CAN do in them, for example buy internet Package X if you use YouTube or internet Package Y if you want to use Facebook .. etc.
They still can charge you based on usage or sell you predefined bandwidth limits, but they can't change that based on what you do with the internet.
